Class Bar

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bar

  • public class Bar
extends java.lang.Object
    Bar class A labeled bar that can serve as a single bar in a bar graph. The text for the label is centered under the bar. NOTE: we have provided the public interface for this class. Do not change the public interface. You can add private instance variables, constants, and private methods to the class. You will also be completing the implementation of the methods given.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bar(int bottom, int left, int width, int numUnits, double unitsPerPixel, java.awt.Color color, java.lang.String label)
      Creates a labeled bar.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bar

        public Bar(int bottom,
   int left,
   int width,
   int numUnits,
   double unitsPerPixel,
   java.awt.Color color,
   java.lang.String label)
        Creates a labeled bar. You give the height of the bar in application units (e.g., population of a particular state), and then a scale for how tall to display it on the screen (parameter unitsPerPixel).
        Parameters:
        bottom - location of the bottom of the label
        left - location of the left side of the bar
        width - width of the bar
        numUnits - height of the bar in application units
        unitsPerPixel - how many application units per pixel for height
        color - the color of the bar
        label - the label at the bottom of the bar

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        Draw the labeled bar.
        Parameters:
        g2 - the graphics context
